comments.raw_text:
You can already do this from a bookmark folder - bookmark all the links you want to be able to open as a group in a folder, and then right click the folder and open all in tabs.

If you are starting from a text file of links, prefix each line with firefox --new-tab so that you end up with a list like:
firefox --new-tab http://www.mozilla.com
firefox --new-tab http://www.google.com
firefox --new-tab http://bugzilla.mozilla.org

(Hint, a quick search and replace on a text file can easily make such a list.)
comments.creator: sdaugherty@gmail.com

comments.text:
Created attachment 531040
Example plain text address list

I've added a bookmarklet into the URL field of this bug, you can drag that directly to your bookmarks toolbar to be clicked on when in Firefox you are viewing a .txt file of addresses (such as the attached example) and have selected multiple lines on the page.

Note: The addresses will only open in new tabs instead of new windows if you have changed the value of the preference named
browser.link.open_newwindow.restriction
in about:config to 0

If you set a keyword in the properties of the bookmarklet, you can invoke it from the addressbar using that keyword and pasting multiple lines of addresses from your clipboard after it (Firefox automatically concatenates them together).

If nothing on a webpage of links is selected when you click the bookmarklet, it will prompt you to paste in addresses from your clipboard (again it will concatentate multiple lines into one).
The code could probably be improved, but I thought you could benefit from this quick workaround immediately :)
